@graph.caption: two buñuelos de viento on a plate with violet napkin

@graph.name: Buñuelos de Viento « Dora's Table
@graph.description: Buñuelos de viento, crispy snowflake-shaped fritters covered in cinnamon sugar. A traditional Mexican Christmas dessert made vegan.

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Where can I get the buñuelo mold?

acceptedAnswer.text: Check your local Mexican market, if it's not available you can purchase it online.

@graph.name: Can I make the batter ahead of time?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, the batter can be made the day before and stored in the fridge.

@graph.name: Do I need to cure the buñuelo mold?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, to cure it heat oil to 350°F. Place mold in the oil and let sit for 15 minutes. Turn heat off and let the mold sit there until the oil is completely cold. Now it is ready to use.

@graph.name: The batter won't stick to the buñuelo mold, what do I do??

acceptedAnswer.text: Two things could be happening here, you have not drained off enough of the oil or the mold is not hot enough. Make sure to heat your mold in the hot oil for about a minute, then remove from the oil and let the excess oil drip off.

@graph.name: The batter is stuck to my buñuelo mold, how can I fix it?

acceptedAnswer.text: Your oil or your buñuleo mold are too hot. Make sure your oil is exactly 350°F degrees and that you are only heating it up in the hot oil for about a minute.

@graph.name: Buñuelos de Viento
@graph.description: These buñuelos de viento are crispy snowflake shaped fritters covered in cinnamon sugar. The crunch and sweetness of them will keep you coming back for more. They are truly irresistible!
recipeIngredient: ¼ cup Primal Kitchen Avocado Oil
1 cup Cinnamon-sugar ((1 cup sugar + 2 tbsp cinnamon))

itemListElement.text: To make the cinnamon sugar, in a bowl combine the sugar and cinnamon and set aside.
itemListElement.name: To make the cinnamon sugar, in a bowl combine the sugar and cinnamon and set aside.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl combine almond milk, vinegar, flaxseed, water, and vanilla. Whisk to combine, set aside, and let rest for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl combine almond milk, vinegar, flaxseed, water, and vanilla. Whisk to combine, set aside, and let rest for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Over a large bowl sift the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Pour in the milk mixture and whisk to combine.
itemListElement.name: Over a large bowl sift the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Pour in the milk mixture and whisk to combine.

itemListElement.text: Pour in the oil and whisk until all the lumps in the batter have disappeared. The batter should be the texture of a thin pancake batter. Set aside and let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Pour in the oil and whisk until all the lumps in the batter have disappeared. The batter should be the texture of a thin pancake batter. Set aside and let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil to 350F. Place the mold in the oil and heat for 1 minute. Remove mold from the oil and let excess oil drip off.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil to 350F. Place the mold in the oil and heat for 1 minute. Remove mold from the oil and let excess oil drip off.

itemListElement.text: Dip the mold in the batter, but only ¾ way. Do not completely submerge the mold. Hold the mold in the batter for 10 seconds. Lift the mold from the batter and hold 10 seconds in the air.
itemListElement.name: Dip the mold in the batter, but only ¾ way. Do not completely submerge the mold. Hold the mold in the batter for 10 seconds. Lift the mold from the batter and hold 10 seconds in the air.

itemListElement.text: Submerge the mold in the hot oil for 3 seconds then start shaking the mold up and down (not vigorously) to release the batter from the mold. If the mold doesn’t come off, use a chopstick to help unstick it.
itemListElement.name: Submerge the mold in the hot oil for 3 seconds then start shaking the mold up and down (not vigorously) to release the batter from the mold. If the mold doesn’t come off, use a chopstick to help unstick it.

itemListElement.text: Once the batter has been released from the mold fry until golden brown on each side. Remove from the oil and place on a sheet tray lined with paper towels. Let cool for a minute then dust with cinnamon-sugar.
itemListElement.name: Once the batter has been released from the mold fry until golden brown on each side. Remove from the oil and place on a sheet tray lined with paper towels. Let cool for a minute then dust with cinnamon-sugar.
